title: OpenAI Introduces Personalized Chatbots: A Step Towards Autonomous AI Agents
originSummary: OpenAI has introduced personalized chatbots, empowering users to create their own chatbots for specific tasks and incorporate private data into their responses.
While some AI safety researchers have concerns about autonomous AI agents, there is significant interest and potential for AI assistants to perform valuable tasks for individuals and businesses.

OpenAI's custom chatbots are currently limited in capabilities but represent a step forward in their gradual iterative deployment strategy. In the future, users will be able to offer their chatbots to the public through OpenAI's version of an app store. The author experimented with creating custom chatbots like a day care helper and a financial advice chatbot, revealing the potential benefits and implications of autonomous AI agents.

title: Cloud software company Amplitude attracts generative AI start-ups and positions itself to benefit from AI industry growth
originSummary: Amplitude, a cloud software company, is gaining attention from generative AI start-ups.
The company specializes in analyzing and enhancing customer experiences with digital products.
Amplitude's expertise and focus on digital products have made it popular among tech start-ups, and it is now experiencing increased demand from generative AI companies.

title: The Power of AI: Transforming Academic Research and Writing
originSummary: AI language models like ChatGPT have the potential to transform academic research.
Incremental prompting is a technique that allows for more advanced answers and can save researchers time.
Other AI-powered tools, such as Consensus, Elicit.org, Scite.ai, Research Rabbit, and ChatPDF, are available to assist with academic writing, research, and analysis.

title: AI Models Limitations: Google Researchers Find Current AI Models Struggle to Generate Outputs Beyond Trained Data
originSummary: DeepMind researchers have found that AI models, including transformer models like OpenAI's GPT-2, have difficulty generating outputs outside of their training data, limiting their ability to generalize.

This study raises concerns about the current limitations of AI models and contradicts claims made by CEOs like OpenAI's Sam Altman and Microsoft's Satya Nadella, who believe in achieving AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) soon.
The research emphasizes the importance of caution and managing expectations, highlighting that AI still heavily relies on human expertise.

title: Introducing the Humane Ai Pin: A Glimpse into the Future of Smartphone Alternatives
originSummary: Humane has introduced Ai Pin, a screenless wearable device that aims to replace smartphones.
The device uses a "laser ink display" to project visuals onto the user's palm and relies on voice commands and OpenAI's model for communication.

Ai Pin offers features such as providing food nutrition facts, real-time translations, and prioritizes privacy with manual activation and a "prominent Trust Light." It will be available for orders in November, starting at $699, and shipping is expected in early 2024.

title: Unmasking the Mysterious Contributors: Investigating the Role of AI in Journalism
originSummary: The podcast "What Next: TBD" delves into a newsroom's concerns regarding the legitimacy of new contributors on their review website.
The episode investigates whether these contributors are real individuals or the initial integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into the newsroom.
Will Sommer, a media reporter from the Washington Post, serves as the guest on this episode, discussing the potential implications of AI in journalism.
